  type="class"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/json/ostream">OStream</a></>}>
<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/json/ostream">json::OStream</a> allows writing well-formed JSON without materializing all structures as <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/json/value">json::Value</a> ahead of time. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/json/ostream/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

### operator&lt;&lt;() {#a5ac7cb89caebd966eb95a5cf81142409}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>llvm::raw&#95;ostream &amp; llvm::json::operator&lt;&lt; (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">llvm::raw&#95;ostream</a> &amp; OS, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/json/value">Value</a> &amp; V)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Serializes this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/json/value">Value</a> to JSON, writing it to the provided stream.

The formatting is compact (no extra whitespace) and deterministic. For pretty-printing, use the <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a653cce37b80c03eebe7a00520a8eabb6">formatv()</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/format-provider">format&#95;provider</a> below.

</MemberDefinition>

### fixUTF8() {#ab64ede9b347ffd8eb32ed5e05f2520f4}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::string llvm::json::fixUTF8 (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">llvm::StringRef</a> S)</>}>
Replaces invalid UTF-8 sequences in <code>S</code> with the replacement character (U+FFFD).

The returned string is valid UTF-8. This is much slower than isUTF8, so test that first.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/json-cpp/#l00707">707</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/json-cpp">JSON.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### isUTF8() {#a385765e73480a0f2d49dcc84a8fb70da}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool llvm::json::isUTF8 (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">llvm::StringRef</a> S, size&#95;t &#42; ErrOffset=nullptr)</>}>
Returns true if <code>S</code> is valid UTF-8, which is required for use as JSON.

If it returns false, <code>Offset</code> is set to a byte offset near the first error.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/json-cpp/#l00693">693</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/json-cpp">JSON.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### parse() {#a15ac4901fb02274b34ca5df73bd40c25}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Expected&lt; Value &gt; llvm::json::parse (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">llvm::StringRef</a> JSON)</>}>
Parses the provided JSON source, or returns a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/json/parseerror">ParseError</a>.

The returned <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/json/value">Value</a> is self-contained and owns its strings (they do not refer to the original source).

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/json-cpp/#l00682">682</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/json-cpp">JSON.cpp</a>.
